subject: Law
title: Sentencing Guidelines
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Sentencing Guidelines.

hook.text: Two people commit the same crime in different courtrooms. One gets probation. The other gets five years. Why?

buildup.text: Sentencing guidelines give judges a recommended range based on the crime's severity and the defendant's history.

discovery.text: Federal guidelines score offenses on a grid: offense level on one axis, criminal history on the other.

twist.text: After United States v. Booker (2005), federal guidelines became advisory, not mandatory. Judges have more discretion.

climax.text: This creates a tension: discretion allows fairness but also allows disparity based on race, class, or geography.

punchline.text: Guidelines aim for consistency. Humans make it complicated.
